member.name: P:Microsoft.ReportingServices.Interfaces.IDeliveryExtension.IsPrivilegedUser
member.summary: Indicates whether the user is allowed access to all the functionality of the extension.
member.returns: A Boolean value that indicates whether the user is allowed access to all the functionality of the extension. When set to false, the extension prevents the user from accessing functionality as defined by the report server. The default value is false. If a user that creates the subscription has Manage All Subscriptions permission as part of his or her defined role, the value of the property is true.This property is never set by your delivery extension. You must implement the property so that the report server can properly manage it, but it is never used by your delivery extension code.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ReportingServices.DataProcessing.CommandType.TableDirect
member.summary: When the property is set to TableDirect, the property should be set to the name of the table or tables to be accessed. The user may be required to use escape character syntax or include qualifying characters if any of the tables named contain any special characters. All rows and columns of the named table or tables will be returned when you call one of the Execute methods. In order to access multiple tables, use a comma-delimited list, without spaces or padding, containing the names of the tables to access. When the property names multiple tables, a join of the specified tables is returned.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReportingServices.Interfaces.CreateAndRegisterStream
member.summary: Creates and registers a stream and is called by a report server to retrieve the stream to which to render a report.
member.param: The name of the stream. The first stream asked for must be the main body of the report, for example, the HTML for an HTML rendering, or the first page for a page-based rendering. The names must be unique within a report and must use only the characters 0-9, a-z (lower case only) and underscore (_). The underscore may not be used as the first character of the name.
The file extension of the stream.
The character encoding of the stream. This can be null if the stream does not contain characters.
The MIME type of the stream.

Whether the stream needs to be seek-enabled. If false, the stream is forward only and is sent to the client in chunks, as created. If true, the stream is spooled to disk and not sent until it is closed. The default value is false.
Indicates the operation (a value) that the method performs.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReportingServices.Interfaces.Setting

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReportingServices.Interfaces.StreamOper
member.summary: Defines the operation that is used by the method. Rendering extensions may request a stream that is available for client applications through SOAP or URL access or a temporary stream to be used during the rendering process.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ReportingServices.Interfaces.StreamOper.CreateAndRegister
member.summary: Create a stream and register its name so that it can be returned through the SOAP API for subsequent client requests. The first stream registered is the primary output stream.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ReportingServices.Interfaces.StreamOper.CreateOnly
member.summary: Only create a stream. This feature is used to create temporary streams that can be used by the rendering extension to handle large memory requirements. This temporary stream is not available for subsequent client requests.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ReportingServices.Interfaces.StreamOper.RegisterOnly
member.summary: Register the stream as a secondary stream for the rendering extension. The method does not create a stream, but instead, the callback returns null and registers the name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ReportingServices.Interfaces.StreamOper.CreateForPersistedStreams
member.summary: Create a single persisted stream for users who use the rs:PersistStream=true URL access option. When this option is used, no secondary streams are registered. Instead, the stream data is transmitted one chunk at a time, and user access the next data chunk in the persisted stream by using the same URL access command with the rs:GetNextStream=true option. This option is only applicable to URL access.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ReportingServices.Interfaces.ValidValue
member.summary: Represents a valid value for an extension setting.
